Camera¶

Pixelated Polariser¶

class pycis.model.camera.Camera(sensor_format, pixel_size, bit_depth, qe, epercount, cam_noise, type='monochrome')[source]¶
Parameters

  • sensor_format (tuple) – Number of pixels in each dimension (x, y, ).

  • pix_size (float) – Pixel size in m.

  • bit_depth (int) – Bit depth of sensor. Currently limited to 16.

  • qe (float) – Quantum efficiency or sensor in units e- per photon.

  • epercount (float) – Conversion gain of sensor in units e- per count.

  • cam_noise (float) – Camera noise standard deviation in units e-.

  • type (str) – Describes the mode of sensor operation. Currently supported are: ‘monochrome’, ‘rgb’ (untested) for color imaging and ‘monochrome_polarised’ for monochrome with a pixelated polariser array (currently assume the 2x2 polariser layout of the FLIR Blackfly S).

capture(spectrum, apply_polarisers=None, clean=False)[source]¶

Capture an image.

Parameters

  • spectrum (xr.DataArray) – Spectrum in units of photons / m with dimensions ‘x’, ‘y’, ‘wavelength’ and (optionally) ‘stokes’. If there is no ‘stokes’ dim then the light is assumed to be unpolarised.

  • apply_polarisers (bool) – Whether to apply a pixelated polariser array to the spectrum.

  • clean (bool) – False to add realistic image noise. Clean images used for testing.

Returns

(xr.DataArray) Captured image.

get_pixel_position(x_pixel=None, y_pixel=None)[source]¶

Calculate pixel positions (in m) on the camera’s sensor plane (the x-y plane).

The origin of the x-y coordinate system is the centre of the sensor. Pixel positions correspond to the pixel centres. :param x_pixel: If specified, only return position of these x_pixels. :type x_pixel: float, np.array, xr.DataArray :param y_pixel: If specified, only return position of these y_pixels. :type y_pixel: float, np.array, xr.DataArray :return: x_pos, y_pos, both instances of xr.DataArray

pycis.model.camera.get_pixel_idxs(sensor_format)[source]¶

Get indices of pixel numbers, determining the pixelated polariser layout.

Following the pixel-numbering conventions defined for the FLIR Blackfly S camera in my paper. This may need to be generalised at some point.
